chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Alyssa Marie Littlewind was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take/Drive Veh. w/o Consent-Abandon Veh., a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Sentence is withheld: DE has deposited $1800 dollars with the Clerk of Court, for restitution that is to be paid to victim.  Clerk of Court will forward this $1800 directly to the victim. 
 DE is placed on one year probation.  Conditions of probation:   Complete any counseling deemed appropriate by agent.   Pay $443 court costs including DEF MUST PROVIDE DNA SAMPLE and pay applicable $200 surcharge.

miscConds.notes: $1800 restitution to be paid to victim Sarah Melton.  This amount was deposited by the DE with the Clerk of Court.  Clerk of Court will forward this amount directly to victim.

$443 costs including DEF MUST PROVIDE DNA SAMPLE and pay applicable $200 surcharge.    If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Complete any counseling deemed appropriate by agent.
